str2: Then, at that time. From ho and hote; the when, i.e. At the time that.
Of Hebrew origin; Judas, the name of ten Israelites; also of the posterity of one of them and its region.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From para and didomi; to surrender, i.e yield up, intrust, transmit.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To condemn, judge worthy of punishment. From kata and krino; to judge against, i.e. Sentence.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From meta and the middle voice of melo; to care afterwards, i.e. Regret.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Strengthened from the base of trope; to twist, i.e. Turn quite around or reverse.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Thirty. The decade of treis; thirty.
Neuter of a presumed derivative of arguros; silvery, i.e. cash; specially, a silverling.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
High priest, chief priest. From arche and hiereus; the high-priest; by extension a chief priest.
Comparative of presbus; older; as noun, a senior; specially, an Israelite Sanhedrist or Christian 'presbyter'.
